T1059.001.description: Adversaries may abuse PowerShell to commands and scripts. It can be used for execution and to hide activity.

T1562.001.description: Disabling endpoint protection or clearing logs to hide presence.

T1003.001.description: Dumping memory from Local Security Authority Subsystem Service to steal credentials (e.g. Mimikatz).

T1078.description: Misuse of legitimate credentials to move laterally or persist in the network.

T1567.description: Using legitimate web services (Mega, Dropbox) to steal sensitive corporate data.
